item.title: Tree cutting dumped on the river bank, 28th January
item.description:

item.title: Large potholes, 28th January
item.description:
It’s now more than a month this pothole are growing bigger and become a serious hazard for any biker and also for car when try to avoid them. They also keep on coming at the same spots so the fixing is not done property to seal the tarmac

item.title: Littering, 28th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 82, Hayes Lane, Hayes, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned van full of rubbish, 28th January
item.description:
This van, with Romanian plates, has been abandoned. It is unlocked, has a flat tyre and the back is packed full of rubbish including a fridge. The road it is abandoned on, Eastcote Road, has a Primary School less than 100m away and I have seen children ‘exploring’ the open van - I am very concerned for their safety. The van has been there for at least a week now and could possibly pose a fire risk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastcote Road, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A bush on pavement as you turn right out of the house., 28th January
item.description:
The bush causes obstruction for the two residents. When it’s in bloom is causes a complete blind spot for the driver and when it is not, it scratches the car. The resident has reported the issue to the council (No. 7566781) and heard nothing back. The ask is to please cut it back to a short height. Or remove it entirely.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Scott's Lane, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: London's e‑bike hire: Parking problems amid surging popularity, 28th January
item.description:
London's e‑bike hire: Parking problems amid surging popularity What is the mayor of the borough of Hackney doing about dangerous line bikes left everywhere causing risks to members of public. Money is more important.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London

item.title: Another Dog Poo on the driveway of 4d Goulton Road, E5 8HA, 28th January
item.description:
Same offender, same dog, another dog poo. Once again, the same offender who lives in Althlone Close flats, E5 8HD and has been reported previously, continues to leave his dog poo behind. Same incompetent Hackney Council has failed to deal with this again.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Goulton Road, Hackney, London
